title: Add 'Follow Up' task to Dashboard and Cases pages

requirements.summary: Add 'Follow Up' as a checklist item in frontend/src/features/cases/checklist.ts with an aqua color token so it appears in the default checklist selections and is included in task filtering and counting logic
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Follow Up' checklist item is defined with a label of 'Follow Up' and an aqua color
The item is included in the default checklist selections for new cases
The item participates in open-task count calculations on both Dashboard and Cases pages

file_operations.description: Add a new ChecklistItem for 'Follow Up' in the CHECKLIST_ITEMS array with key 'followUp', label 'Follow Up', and an aqua color value (e.g., 'oklch(0.75 0.15 195)'). Include it in the default selected items returned by getDefaultChecklistSelections() so new cases include this task by default. Ensure getTaskColor() returns the aqua color for the 'followUp' key. Verify the existing getRemainingChecklistItems() logic correctly identifies incomplete Follow Up tasks for open task counts.

requirements.summary: Update frontend/src/components/workflow-icons/workflowTokens.ts to assign an aqua color token to the 'Follow Up' task type and ensure the IconFollowUp.tsx icon uses this aqua color
acceptanceCriteria: The 'Follow Up' task color in workflowTokens.ts is set to an aqua value
The IconFollowUp circular arrow SVG icon renders in aqua when displayed in checklist and task views

file_operations.description: Add a 'followUp' property to WORKFLOW_COLORS with an aqua OKLCH color value matching the one used in checklist.ts (e.g., 'oklch(0.75 0.15 195)'). Ensure consistency with REQ-2 so the Follow Up task displays in the same aqua color across all UI components.

requirements.summary: Ensure the WorkflowIcon dispatcher in frontend/src/components/workflow-icons/WorkflowIcon.tsx maps the 'Follow Up' task type string to the IconFollowUp component so the aqua circular arrow icon renders on both the Dashboard and Cases pages wherever workflow task icons are shown
acceptanceCriteria: WorkflowIcon renders IconFollowUp when given the 'Follow Up' task type
The aqua circular arrow icon is visible on case cards in both DashboardView and CasesListView

file_operations.description: Add a case for 'Follow Up' in the getIconComponent() switch statement that returns <IconFollowUp color={color} />. Ensure the case string matches the 'followUp' key used in checklist.ts and the backend TaskType enum. The icon will automatically receive the aqua color from workflowTokens.ts via the existing color lookup logic.
